Description: Shoulder sherd of probably Milesian Fikellura pottery amphoriskos; buff slip; exterior: eight rows of scales with black and added red central dots.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

scale patterns are commonly found on Clazomenian and other North Ionian amphorae. These are typically dated between 545BC-510BC. The apparent lack of slip on this piece speaks against Cook's attribution to the Fikellura style, although otherwise it seems close to the more obviously Fikellura amphoriskos in the Cabinet des Medailles cited by him.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 248, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.167)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
